name: Muslim Advocates
mission: TO PROMOTE EQUALITY, LIBERTY AND JUSTICE FOR ALL, BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP THROUGH LEGAL ADVOCACY, POLICY ENGAGEMENT AND CIVIC EDUCATION AND BY SERVING A...
theoryOfChange: Works in the courts, the policy making process, and in the public dialogue (litigate, educate, and advocate) to uphold equal treatment under the law so American Muslims and all people can live free from discrimination.
zakatClaimEvidence:
Gifts made to Muslim Advocates are Zakat-eligible, more information is available.
In light of the social justice work Muslim Advocates performs, it is my informed assessment that Muslim Advocates is zakat eligible. This view is consistent with that taken by many legal-advocacy non-profit organizations working in service of Muslim communities. For the reasons set forth below, I believe that MA is a permitted recipient of zakat. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH2vxeQvuWC4CPoTIhgmduAjmuAQLOBvXvCzO_VUgcuJ3dMyV5L0HHZ6r7MFeT0GcjgCBMNchWYbzZNEyby3KbHR2PCh--U7F5pOfrN0XhoFwHnBwLQLQ==)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Advocates shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

In light of the social justice work Muslim Advocates performs, it is my informed assessment that Muslim Advocates is zakat eligible. all_citations.claim: Muslim Advocates is a civil rights organization with a mission to promote equality and justice.
The organization reported total revenue of $992,892, a program expense ratio of 54.9%, and fundraising efficiency of $0.61 per $1 raised.
The organization engages in legal advocacy and provides legal awards as part of its program services.
Muslim Advocates utilizes its resources for legal representation and policy engagement.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides various methods for charitable giving.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a GMG score of 60/100, reflecting a balance between its essential advocacy work and moderate financial efficiency metrics. While it maintains healthy working capital, its program spending and fundraising costs indicate room for operational optimization.
areas_for_improvement: Improve program expense ratio, which currently stands at 54.9%
Enhance fundraising efficiency to reduce the $0.61 cost per dollar raised
Increase transparency to improve data confidence and impact reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 29/50, the charity addresses urgent civil rights causes but shows low donor fit for those seeking high-efficiency direct service models [1]. Its mission to promote liberty and justice is supported by its zakat-eligible status for eligible donors [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through legal awards and policy engagement, though its impact score of 31/50 reflects a need for more direct evidence of cost-effectiveness [3][5]. Financial data shows a program expense ratio of 54.9% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.61 per $1 raised [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Advocates is a national civil rights organization dedicated to promoting equality and justice through legal advocacy and policy engagement.
strengths: Maintains a zakat-eligible status for charitable giving
Provides specialized legal representation and policy advocacy for the Muslim community
holds 7.8 months of working capital to sustain operations
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Washington, D.C., Muslim Advocates provides legal representation and civic education to protect the rights of all Americans [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $992,892 and is recognized as a zakat-eligible entity for donors seeking to support civil rights initiatives [2][8].
